candidates.title: Release/0.8.0
candidates.body: Fixes #3332 (didn't seem worth creating a separate PR)

candidates.title: chore:added a testcase for `sqlx migrate add ...`
candidates.body:
### Does your PR solve an issue?

During https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/issues/3348 I noticed that there is no testcase for the `sqlx migrate add ...` command. This PR proposes such a testcase.

I don't know how usefull this testcase is (as the testcase is working and has not found any bugs..).
Rejecting this PR because this is not worth your time is fine by me ^^

candidates.title: fix:the `json`-feature should activate `sqlx-postgres?/json` as well
candidates.body:
As discussed (or more accurately missed by me), the `json` feature should also activate the postgres' related `json` feature.

(I thought that you might like this as a PR as this is simpler for you to accept. If you want your commit in your name, that is fine too ^^)

| Before | After |
|--------|--------|
| ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/52a0bbdc-81a5-4baf-972b-cff6bcc0e730) | ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4f0e490c-5bfa-4f17-b202-e92851c7b3dc) | 


### Does your PR solve an issue?
Fixes https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/issues/3316

candidates.title: ci: Add job to check that sqlx builds with its declared minimum dependencies
candidates.body:
Prevents future occurrences of situations similar to https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/issues/3118, where a change was made to `sqlx` to resolve a deprecation warning, the change is not supported by the dependency version declared in `Cargo.toml`, and the lock file has a newer version than what is declared `Cargo.toml`.

New CI job forces a downgrade of all dependencies to their minimum versions (ignoring the committed lock file), and attempts to compile the crate and its tests.

In `Cargo.toml`, the `chrono` and `log` crates were both upgraded to the oldest version that allowed the `sqlx` crate to build. This did not impact the lock file, which has newer versions of both.

candidates.title: fix: correct handling of arrays of custom types in Postgres
candidates.body: Potential breaking change: `PgTypeInfo::with_name()` infers types that start with `_` to be arrays of the un-prefixed type. Wrap type names in quotes to bypass this behavior.

candidates.title: security: bump rustls to 0.21.11
candidates.body:
This fixes security issue RUSTSEC-2024-0336 [1].

[1] https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2024-0336

candidates.title: Update time to 0.3.36
candidates.body: fixes #3189

candidates.title: [BREAKING} fix(sqlite): always use `i64` as intermediate when decoding
candidates.body:
Breaking changes:

* integer decoding will now loudly error on overflow instead of silently truncating.
* some usages of the `query!()` macros might change an `i32` to an `i64`.

Also adds support for *decoding* `u64`s because there's no reason not to.

Closes #3179

Supercedes #3180

@elsirion can you try this and confirm it fixes the problem?

candidates.title: fix: Option decoding in any driver
candidates.body: fixes #2416

candidates.title: Bump deps that do not need code changes
candidates.body: This cleans up the dep tree of projects depending and should duplicates over time. rustls still needs updating, but it seems like quite extensive migration is needed which I didn't feel comfortable to perform.

candidates.title: Drop urlencoding dependency
candidates.body: This drops the [unmaintained](https://github.com/kornelski/rust_urlencoding/commit/3cc277fc4e577a0bef99294d7ab9bc85232f0730) and scary looking use of the `urlencoding` crate with a more proper implementation using `serde_urlencoded` and `percent-encoding`

candidates.title: Bump libsqlite3-sys to v0.28
candidates.body: This includes SQLite v3.45(.1), which includes new JSONB functionality.

candidates.title: feat: new derive feature flag
candidates.body:
As mentioned in https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/pull/2482#issuecomment-1992717206, the current `macros` flag enables a ton of unrelated things. Personally, my use of SQLx is almost always limited to the derive macros, and I don't want to be bombarded with `query_*!` macros every time I enable the derives. The new `derive` feature flag solves this.

Derives will still be enabled when using the `macros` feature.

candidates.title: Remove sha1 because it's not being used in postgres
candidates.body:
### Does your PR solve an issue?

There's no open issue for it. But SHA1 is not cryptographically secure and it wasn't being used in sqlx-postgres.

candidates.title: fix: do not panic when binding a large BigDecimal
candidates.body: Fixes #3052

candidates.title: Optimize SASL auth in sqlx-postgres
candidates.body:
Don't recreate the HMAC, just [reset](https://docs.rs/hmac/latest/hmac/trait.Mac.html#tymethod.finalize_reset). That feature exists for a reason :) This makes postgres sasl auth 2-3ms faster (or 40ms in debug mode). 

Benchmark results (with `+nightly` `#![feature(test)]` `extern crate test;`) on M1 Pro:

before: 
```
test connection::sasl::bench_sasl_hi                                        ... bench:   4,004,666 ns/iter (+/- 73,042)
```

after 
```
test connection::sasl::bench_sasl_hi                                        ... bench:   2,065,200 ns/iter (+/- 15,375)
```

candidates.title: chore(deps): Upgrade criterion to 0.5.1
candidates.body: Resolves advisory [RUSTSEC-2021-0145](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2021-0145) related to `atty` crate by using a newer version of `criterion` that does not have `atty` as a dependency.

candidates.title: chore(dev-deps): Upgrade env_logger from 0.9 to 0.11
candidates.body:
Upgrade the `env_logger` dependency.

Only used in `dev-dependencies` (`sqlx-test` is not published).

candidates.title: chore(deps): Replace unmaintained tempdir crate with tempfile
candidates.body: Last release of `tempdir` was [six years ago](https://crates.io/crates/tempdir/versions).

candidates.title: chore: Update ahash to 0.8.7
candidates.body:
Update ahash to version 0.8.7 to resolve vulnerability RUSTSEC-2023-0074.

```

Version:   0.7.26
Title:     Some Ref methods are unsound with some type parameters

Solution:  Upgrade to >=0.2.9, <0.3.0 OR >=0.3.2, <0.4.0 OR >=0.4.1, <0.5.0 OR >=0.5.2, <0.6.0 OR >=0.6.6, <0.7.0 OR >=0.7.31
Dependency tree:

└── ahash 0.8.6

    │   │   │           ├── sqlx-example-postgres-listen 0.1.0
    │   │   │           ├── sqlx-example-postgres-json 0.1.0
    │   │   │           ├── sqlx-example-postgres-files 0.1.0
    │   │   │           ├── sqlx-example-postgres-chat 0.1.0
    │   │   │           ├── sqlx-example-postgres-axum-social 0.1.0
    │   │   │           ├── sqlx-example-mysql-todos 0.1.0
    │   │   │           ├── sqlx-core 0.7.3
    │   │   │           └── sqlx-cli 0.7.3
    │   │   └── sqlx 0.7.3
    │   ├── sqlx-postgres 0.7.3

        ├── indexmap 2.1.0
```

candidates.title: sqlx-core: Remove dotenvy dependency
candidates.body:
sqlx-core doesn't use dotenvy. Removing it means that users who only
depend on sqlx with sqlite and default-feature = false don't need it.

candidates.title: Add Debug impl for PgRow
candidates.body:
fixes #150

Adds partial `Debug` impl for `PgRow`. Utilises a mapping between `PgType` variants and types. For the variants for which the mapping is not defined falls back to string or binary representation.

candidates.title: Use `create_new` instead of `atomic-file-write`
candidates.body: This provides the same functionality but without temporary files, platform-specific code, fragility of `O_TMPFILE` support, and an extra dependency.

chosen_pr.title: Release/0.8.0
chosen_pr.body: Fixes #3332 (didn't seem worth creating a separate PR)

chosen_detail.title: Release/0.8.0
chosen_detail.body: Fixes #3332 (didn't seem worth creating a separate PR)

repo.name: sqlx
repo.description: 🧰 The Rust SQL Toolkit. An async, pure Rust SQL crate featuring compile-time checked queries without a DSL. Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite.
